title: The Gig Economy
description: News report about modern work trends
transcript: The gig economy is changing how we work. Instead of traditional full-time jobs, more people are working as freelancers, contractors, or through apps like Uber and Deliveroo. This shift offers flexibility – you can choose when to work and take on multiple projects. For some, it's a way to earn extra income alongside a regular job. For others, it's their primary livelihood. However, gig workers often lack benefits that traditional employees enjoy – health insurance, paid holidays, pension contributions. Income can be unpredictable, with some weeks much busier than others. There's also the issue of worker classification. Are gig workers independent contractors or should they be classified as employees with corresponding rights? Courts in different countries have ruled differently on this question. Supporters say the gig economy provides opportunities for people who want flexibility. Critics argue it creates insecurity and shifts risk from companies to workers. As technology advances, this debate will only become more important for society to address.
